Dorong Perbaikan Sosial, Aruna Juara Startup Pilihan Tempo 2019
04 Nov 2019, 00:17 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Start up atau perusahaan rintisan e-commerce di bidang perikanan, Aruna menjadi pemenang kategori Best Social Impact dalam Startup Pilihan Tempo 2019." Terpilihnya Aruna sebagai pemenang kategori ini karena memiliki visi yang memberikan impak pada nelayan.
"Visi founder untuk memberikan social impact bagi nelayan sangat besar. Mereka ingin memajukan kehidupan nelayan yang selama ini termasuk 25 persen kelompok masyarakat miskin," ujar Direktur Eksekutif Tempo.co yang juga tim juri, Burhan Sholihin di Jakarta, Ahad 3 November 2019.
PT Tempo Inti Media Tbk mengelar kembali "Startup Pilihan Tempo 2019." Acara yang memasuki tahun ketiga ini digelar bekerja sama dengan Digitaraya dan juga Gojek.
Untuk tahun ini ada tiga kategori yang diperebutkan. Ketiganya adalah Best Social Impact, Best Newcomer dan People's Choice. Dalam ajang ini panitia menerima ratusan aplikan dari start up yang mengajukan diri, yang kemudian dipilih 10 untuk menjalani rangkaian penilaian.
Kategori Best Social Impact fokus pada start up yang menyediakan solusi berdampak sosial tinggi mulai dari ekonomi, budaya, dan lingkungan sekitar, baik profit maupun non profit. Kriteria berikutnya, perusahaan tersebut menawarkan solusi dengan pendekatan yang inovatif, serta bisa diukur dampaknya secara nyata.
Burhan menjelaskan, dengan membangun aplikasi, Aruna berhasil menghubungkan nelayan dengan perusahaan besar. Sehingga nelayan bisa fokus bekerja meningkatkan target ikan yang dibutuhkan konsumen serta mempunyai nilai tambah tinggi.
Pendapatan nelayan-nelayan yang ikut dalam program Aruna rata-rata naik 3 kali lipat menjadi US$ 240 per bulan. Padahal, rata-rata nelayan hanya mendapatkan penghasilan US$ 84 per bulan. Selain itu, Aruna juga berorientasi mengajak nelayan untuk mengekspor hasil tangkapannya.
"Mereka juga melakukan pelatihan bersama Kementerian2 kepada para nelayan, sehingga nelayan lebih melek teknologi," kata Burhan.
Dengan catatan itu, tim juri menilai visi besar founder Aruna tampak kuat. Aruna ingin membuat Indonesia maju dari sisi maritim. Aruna, dalam penilaian para juri ingin memajukan Indonesia dari sisi sektor kelautan.
Sementara itu, layanan startup yang dipimpin oleh Farid Naufal Aslam ini telah ada pada 15 titik di berbagai provinsi di Indonesia. Total nelayan yang telah bergabung sebagai mitra Aruna mencapai lebih dari 3 ribu orang.
Hasil perikanan yang diperjualbelikan pun bervariasi mulai dari beragam ikan, kepiting, udang, lobster, hingga produk hasil laut lain. Sedangkan pasar ekspor untuk produk hasil tangkapan mitra Aruna kini dikirim ke berbagai negara seperti Cina, Amerika Serikat, Malaysia, Jepang, dan Korea Selatan.

DIAS PRASONGKO
text:
Encouraging Social Improvement, Aruna Wins Tempo 2019 Startup Options
04 Nov 2019, 00:17 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Start-up or e-commerce startup in the field of fisheries, Aruna won the Best Social Impact category in the 2019 Tempo Options Startup. "Aruna was chosen as the winner of this category because it has a vision that gives impact to fishermen.
"The founder's vision to provide a social impact for fishermen is very large. They want to advance the lives of fishermen who so far have included 25 percent of poor communities," said Tempo.co Executive Director who is also a jury team, Burhan Sholihin in Jakarta, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
PT Tempo Inti Media Tbk is holding back "Tempo Choice Startup 2019." The event, which entered its third year, was held in collaboration with Digitaraya and Gojek.
For this year there are three categories contested. The three are Best Social Impact, Best Newcomer and People's Choice. In this event the committee received hundreds of applicants from start-ups who submitted themselves, who were then chosen 10 to undergo a series of assessments.
The Best Social Impact category focuses on start-ups that provide high-impact social solutions ranging from the economy, culture, and the surrounding environment, both profit and non-profit. The next criterion, the company offers a solution with an innovative approach, and can be measured in real terms.
Burhan explained, by building the application, Aruna succeeded in connecting fishermen with large companies. So that fishermen can focus on working to increase the target fish needed by consumers and have high added value.
The income of the fishermen participating in the Aruna program on average increased three-fold to US $ 240 per month. In fact, the average fisherman only earns US $ 84 per month. In addition, Aruna is also oriented towards inviting fishermen to export their catch.
"They also conduct training together with the Ministries to the fishermen, so that fishermen are more technology literate," said Burhan.
With that note, the jury considered the founder of Aruna's vision to be strong. Aruna wants to make Indonesia progress from the maritime side. Aruna, in the assessment of the judges, wanted to advance Indonesia in terms of the marine sector.
Meanwhile, the startup service, led by Farid Naufal Aslam, has been available at 15 points in various provinces in Indonesia. The total number of fishermen who have joined as Aruna's partners has reached more than 3 thousand people.
Fishery products traded also vary from a variety of fish, crabs, shrimps, lobsters, to other marine products. Meanwhile, the export market for Aruna partner's catch products is now sent to various countries such as China, the United States, Malaysia, Japan and South Korea.
